When syncing different devices, the following limitations will apply if an entry has been modified on more than one device:
• Ministry schedule will overwrite using the latest info entered.
• Report time will use the latest info entered.

"• Return visits will be merged if you haven't modified their content on multiple devices. Merging will overwrite older information so that the most recent information entered for the visit will be displayed on all devices."

Tap to create streets, apartment buildings, or rural territories
Tap to create a new territory
If you want to add more addresses or apartments to your territory
Welcome to Ministry Assistant – the fun way to keep track of your ministry!
Ministry Assistant allows you to quickly and easily create territories, keep track of return visits and your monthly report, and plan your field service for the day.
You can quickly create a street, apartment building or rural territory, select which neighborhood it belongs to, and even take a photo of the territory card.

Enter the street name and the highest and lowest house numbers on the street to generate each house in between. For example, “My Street, 1 to 51, odd numbers”, creates house numbers 1, 3, 5, etc. It is also possible to enter letters as part of the house number, e.g. 1A, 1B, 1C, etc.

Tip: Any new house numbers you add to an existing street will automatically be merged and sorted so as to appear in the right order. The same is true for any new floors or names you might enter for an apartment building.
Here you can select the number of floors in the building as well as enter the names of those living on each floor.

Tip: If you enter the street name and building number together in the “street name” field, you will get an easy-to-use overview showing just one entrance/stairwell at a time. This will make it easier for you to navigate through your territory when out in the field.
Add a description for each address. Unlike apartment buildings and street addresses, these entries will not be sorted, but will remain in the order in which you entered them.
Tip: You can easily rearrange these addresses to be displayed in any order you wish.

It’s easy to enter the outcome of calls while you’re out working your territory, e.g. if the householder was not interested or didn’t have time, or if you left a letter in their mailbox (if legal) because no one was at home, or to add the name of someone new you met at a door you have called on before.
Tip: You can add new addresses to a district at any time while out working your territory.

You can also view the number of households you have left to visit, the number of interested persons in the territory, etc., and can quickly pull up a list of addresses from just one street, of those you have not yet met, or of those who were interested. You can even view statistics as to on which days and at which times you have worked the territory previously.

When you meet someone who is interested, you enter their details as a visit. You can enter their family name and which person in the family you met at the door, which languages they speak, their e-mail address, and any other relevant information.

Tip: You can easily create a literature list with your own abbreviations, or, if you wish to, enter a line about what the latest publication/magazine you placed with a householder was about, instead of just entering the month of its issue.
When you make a return visit, you simply add a new conversation to the householder’s entry and make appropriate notes about what you discussed.
Interested people you have met in your territories can quickly be added to a return visits list. You can also create return visit entries for households that are not located in your own territories.
Return visits can be sorted according to location, how long it has been since you last met them, or so as to show those you have bookmarked as priority visits.

Use bookmarks to flag those visits you want to prioritize, e.g. when planning which visits you want to call back on during the current day or week. Just as with return visits, you can sort bookmarked calls according to where they live or how long ago you met them.
To help you keep track of your service, you can enter what you have accomplished so far and check how well you’re doing for that month in particular, or for the service year overall.
You can also select a special profile, e.g. auxiliary pioneer, or set up a goal you want to reach during the month.
Once a month has ended, Ministry Assistant allows you to conveniently compile and send your report to the congregation secretary.
Tip: You can pre-select a phone number/e-mail address as the standard recipient for your report under the Settings menu, so that you don’t have to enter it each time you send your report.

You should regularly make backup copies of the information stored in Ministry Assistant to avoid losing your territory and return visit records if your phone should break, be stolen, or if something else unexpected should happen.
You can choose to either save a backup copy to your SD card, or to send it to an e-mail address.
Tip: You can open menus containing additional functions for almost all lists simply by long-pressing the list item.

Tip: You can send addresses and return visit information to other publishers via either text message or e-mail, e.g. if another publisher is going to take over the visit, or if you are several publishers working the same district simultaneously.
How do I alter a monthly report that is more than three months old?
Just long press what you want to remove and select \"Delete\".
This refers to the hours full-time servants report when they help to build a Kingdom Hall, for example.
Are remaining minutes transferred to the following month?
"Yes! After you send the report by text message or e-mail, you'll be asked if you want to transfer any remaining minutes to next month's total."
How do I edit incorrect data in the service report?
In the report view, go to the daily service list and tap the day you want to edit.
How do I display LDC hours data?

"If you're a pioneer, go to the report view and select the pioneer profile (top right corner). If you want to display these hours even if you're not a pioneer, select the pioneer option from the settings."
Create a report for any day of the month you wish to alter the report for and enter a positive/negative value for the item you wish to change.
In almost all lists, you can long press the item and select \"Delete\".
"This is because you've installed the app on the SD card. Open Android settings, Applications, Ministry Assistant, and move it back to the phone memory."
"Make sure you've set the correct start month. It's the month for THIS service year. You have to set this for each new service year."
How do I restore a backup copy to a new phone or phone that has been reset to its factory settings?
Place the backup file in the /MinistryAssistant/ folder on your SD card. Then select “Restore backup” from the menu on the first page of the application and select your file.
Whom should I contact if I find an error in the application or have a suggestion for how to improve it?

Send an e-mail to pixelslost@gmail.com that includes a description of how the error can be reproduced. If you had to force close the application or if the application crashed, please attach the “error-xxx” files from /MinistryAssistant/ on the SD card, which will provide additional information.
How do I change my number of hours in service if I made a mistake?
Go to the monthly report view. Tap the list symbol in the lower/right corner and select what you want to edit from the list. You can also long press an item to delete it.
How do I remove a return visit?
Import data and merge with current territories?

"Sort all street/area names alphabetically (otherwise they'll be in the order created)."
"Example: From 1 to 10 to create 1, 2,…, 10 From A to E to create A, B,…, E From 1A to 4C to create 1A, 1B,…, 4C"

"WARNING: If you clean trash files with Clean Master, all your backups and profile image will be removed. You can send an email to support@cmcm.com and ask them to exclude your MinistryAssistant folder to fix this problem."
